column1:
If
9x2+6x
(x+6)(-4x2-13x+58)
 = A(x+6) + Bx+C(-4x2-13x+58)

then find the value of A,B and C
column8:
Rearrange the equation in the form
9x2+6x = A(-4x2-13x+58) + Bx(x+6) + C(x+6)
column9: Substitute the value of x such that terms B and C are removed from the equation to get A. Now use this value of A in the equation and substitute a new value of x to derive the value of C.Use the values of A and C in equation 1 to derive the value of B
column10: Based on the above hint , you need to substitute the value of x = -6 to get the value of A . Substitute the value of A in the equation and put x = 0 to get the value of C. Now put the values of A and C in the equation to get the value of B

column1:

column8:

factorized and reduced to factors of the lowest degree

of the other two terms as well
